title: Font used for, OF THIS TALE, I CANNOT GUARANTEE A SINGLE WORD
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101225125714im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Mike-Nelson_3607.jpg)

Let me start by explaining, I found these images on the website of [A Practice For Everyday Life](http://web.archive.org/web/20101225125714/http:/www.apracticeforeverydaylife.com/docs/curation/curation.htm) in which they explain that this font is a customized Futura.

However the capital 'M' with curl in 'Mike' reminds me of something,  
if only I could remember which font?  
I hope someone does ;-)

A+
author: Allison Dh

comments.content: The M looks like the [Monocle](http://web.archive.org/web/20101225125714/http:/www.monocle.com/) logo.

Ha! That's right Chris.  
Yet, I'm quite sure I've seen it in a font,... ?

You are not thinking of the M in one of the faces of [Yolanda](http://web.archive.org/web/20101225125714/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/device/yolanda/) are you?

- Mike Yanega
This one came up before: [Modern san serif swash font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20101225125714/http:/www.typophile.com/node/53248)
I feel a bit sad suggesting this [link removed by moderator] but if it will help why not?

Sorry to say, but the twilight font looks like a knock-off from [Zephyr](http://web.archive.org/web/20101225125714/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5WE) by Gábor Kóthay, which is the base for the Twilight logo.
No, don't be sorry Renko. I'd always assumed the 'Twilight' font was another font but never had the time to investigate. So that's good to know. Thank you.

Thanks all of you to help!  
I like Zephyr (although it's not a geometric like the customer requested)  
and I will see if it works for the customer too?  
Thumbs up ;-)  
A+
